item.title: Tracy add a quote by Edna St. Vincent Millay
item.description: "Please give me some good advice in your next letter. I promise not to follow it. (in a letter written while she was in college)" -- Edna St. Vincent Millay

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Gene Youngblood
item.description: "An interested person is an interesting person." -- Gene Youngblood

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Emma Goldman
item.description: "If I can't dance to it, it's not my revolution." -- Emma Goldman

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Doris Lessing
item.description: "That is what learning is. You suddenly understand something you've understood all your life, but in a new way." -- Doris Lessing

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Real solemn history, I cannot be interested in.... The quarrels of popes and kings, with wars and pestilences in every page; the men all so good for nothing, and hardly any women at all." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Emily Dickinson
item.description: "They say that 'home is where the heart is.' I think it is where the house is, and the adjacent buildings." -- Emily Dickinson

item.title: Tracy add a quote by Virginia Woolf
Tracy add a quote by Nikki Giovanni
item.description: "I always loved English because whatever human beings are, we are storytellers. It is our stories that give a light to the future. When I went to college I became a history major because history is such a wonderful story of who we think we are. English is much more a story of who we really are." -- Nikki Giovanni

item.title: Tracy add a quote by William James
item.description: "I am tired of the position of the dried-up critic and doubter. The believer is the true full man. (from a biography of James by Robert D. Richardson)" -- William James
